solution_line_template: He cuts off {max_hair_length}-{cut_hair_length}=<<{max_hair_length}-{cut_hair_length}={inches_cut_per_haircut}>>{inches_cut_per_haircut} inches when he gets a haircut
That means he needs to cut it every {inches_cut_per_haircut}/{hair_growth_per_month}=<<{inches_cut_per_haircut}/{hair_growth_per_month}={months_per_haircut}>>{months_per_haircut} months
So he gets {months_per_year}/{months_per_haircut}=<<{months_per_year}/{months_per_haircut}={haircuts_per_year}>>{haircuts_per_year} haircuts a year
So that means each hair cut cost {haircut_cost}+{tip_amount}=$<<{haircut_cost}+{tip_amount}={total_cost_per_haircut}>>{total_cost_per_haircut}
